results.title: Line
results.creator_credit: Paul Harrison, Lewis Jacobs and Young America Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Elements of design”.
Straight, curved, S-shaped and circular lines are established as being the basis of linear design. Examples in nature stress the need for being aware of line designs in the physical world. There are illustrations of historical use of line in many ways, times, and places. The elements of repetition and rhythm are pointed out in nature, industrial design and architecture

results.title: Linderidge 137
results.creator_credit: New Cinema Workshop and Paul Denby
results.brief_description: Investigates the conventions of storytelling and suspense. The central theme examines the process whereby women in film are represented as the victims of threat and aggression, as the object of the camera’s voyeuristic gaze.

results.title: Linda's film on menstruation
results.creator_credit: Georghe Eichen, Phoenix Films and Linda Feferman

results.title: Lincoln County incident
results.brief_description: A satiric western set in the South Island of New Zealand with a cast and crew of over 100 - all children from a New Zealand secondary school. It involves the escapades of diminutive Sampson Peabody-Jones who, in 1881, heads west in search of adventure and a new life. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Limon's legacy
results.creator_credit: Marvin A Lipman, United States Information Agency and George A. Dolney
results.brief_description: Jose Limon who died in 1962 was a major dancer and choreographer from the second generation of modern American dancers, and his works reflected both the tragedy and grandeur of the human spirit. He saw dance as a “vision of ineffable power”. Segments of Limon’s choreography are presented.

results.title: Limiting the goblin
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
The unidentified submarine intruder known as “the Goblin” is no longer free to trespass at will in Australia’s waters. The “Barra” sonobuoy, the world’s most advanced submarine detection device is now in operation with the Royal Australian Air Force.

results.title: Limbering up
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardner and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: Some of Britain’s outstanding young athletes seen at practice and in action. Sprinters David Jones and Jennie Smart, diver Brian Phelps and swimmer Anita Lonsborough, are among those who show their paces; analyses points of style and movement.

results.creator_credit: Victoria. Education Dept. Audio-Visual Resources Branch
results.brief_description: Uses period recreation to present a case study of life in the rural town of Lilydade in the 1880s. Highlights life styles, attitudes and the environment.

results.title: Lilydale: a change in pace
results.creator_credit: Barbara Boyd-Anderson and Victoria. Education Dept. Audio-Visual Resources Branch
results.brief_description: Presents two eras in the town of Lilydale in Victoria, the 1880’s and the 1980’s to form a case study of an Australian rural town as the metropolis advances towards it. It is a journey in time using archival photographs and diaries focusing particularly on the divergent life styles, attitudes and environments of the two eras of the district. Also includes a period recreation as a means to gain insights into those elements of Lilydale life. Suitable for secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barbara Boyd-Anderson and Victoria. Education Dept. Audio-Visual Resources Branch
